intro: Arrhenechthites albus, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in well-drained sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
